edu.umaryland.igs.idea
Class MouseOverListener

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.event.MouseMotionAdapter
      edu.umaryland.igs.idea.MouseOverListener
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseMotionListener, EventListener
 class MouseOverListener
extends MouseMotionAdapter

The class MouseOverListener serves to replace the function of the tool tip because tool tips on rendered components are inactive. Each MouseOverListener has a table, row and column with which it is associated and a component on which it is listening.

Constructor Detail

MouseOverListener

public MouseOverListener(JTable d,
                         int r,
                         int c,
                         JComponent moh)
The constructor for MouseOverListener takes a table, a row index, a column index and a component which should generate events on mouse over.

Parameters:
d - the table on which this listener is active
r - the row index of the cell to which this listener applies
c - the column index of the cell to which this listener applies
moh - the component on which this listener should listen

mouseMoved

public void mouseMoved(MouseEvent e,
                       boolean recordAsToolTipRequest)
This listener doesn't currently do anything; its purpose is to implement the isWithinHotspot method.

Parameters:
e - a mouse event on the table
recordAsToolTipRequest - whether this method was called indirectly via getToolTipText in SummaryTableHeaderRenderer

isWithinHotspot

public boolean isWithinHotspot(MouseEvent e)
The isWithinHotspot method serves to pass a MouseEvent on to the listener.

Parameters:
e - a MouseEvent which triggered getToolTipText on the table
Returns:
whether the event put the mouse within the bounds of the component on which this listener is listening
